1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Leicestershire-based baker Fiona Cairns, who prepared an eight-tiered wedding cake for the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, shares some of the tricks of her trade. She begins by demonstrating how to create the perfect treats for a tea party, including heart-shaped vanilla shortbreads, fairy cakes in lavender sugar, a rose-petal heart with white chocolate and a lemon Madeira cake.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Baker Fiona Cairns demonstrates four treats featuring summer berries. On the menu are blueberry yoghurt fairy cakes with a cream cheese topping, a berry rose-scented meringue, a flourless chocolate cake with raspberry coulis, and a strawberry and elderflower cake. She also visits a pick-your-own-fruit farm in Leicestershire and teaches novice bakers how to make the perfect Victoria sponge.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Baker Fiona Cairns demonstrates sweet treats inspired by garden vegetables. On the menu are hidden fruit and vegetable muffins, a moist honey cake, a chocolate and beetroot cake and a vegetable plot cake made from carrot and pecan nuts. She also visits a beekeeper to buy top-quality honey and shows three gardeners how to make miniature vegetable cake decorations from sugar paste.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Baker Fiona Cairns demonstrates how to make birthday treats for all ages. On the menu are easy gingerbread biscuits, a sticky toffee pudding birthday cake, sponge cakes shaped like ice-cream cones topped with peanut butter and salted caramel, and her most popular chocolate cake. She also shows two teenagers how to prepare and pipe flawless buttercream icing.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Baker Fiona Cairns offers the perfect recipes for a Halloween party. On the menu are peanut and caramel cookies, toffee apple pops filled with buttercream, orange-flavoured cupcakes with sugarpaste monsters, and an erupting volcano marble cake. Plus, she teaches two bakers how to make bats and ghosts using chocolate shortbread.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Baker Fiona Cairns finds inspiration from childhood sweets. On the menu are no-bake chocolate caramel Robots, Turkish delight meringue and a Victoria sponge cake. She also reveals a recipe for rose and violet creams, made with a liqueur.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Leicestershire-based baker Fiona Cairns, who prepared an eight-tiered wedding cake for the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, puts her skills to the test for another matrimonial occasion. Also on the menu are Earl Grey fairy cakes decorated with crystallised flowers and heart-shaped biscuits.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Leicestershire-based baker Fiona Cairns, who prepared an eight-tiered wedding cake for the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, shares some of the tricks of her trade. On the menu, a no-bake white chocolate cheesecake with tangy blackberry coulis and a gilded tiffin made with dried cranberries.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Leicestershire based baker Fiona Cairns, who prepared an eight-tiered wedding cake for the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, gets ready for Christmas with some festive treats, including chocolate fridge buns decorated with snowmen, fat-free angel bites and a traditional pudding in the shape of a present.

imdb.title: Home of Fabulous Cakes
plot: Host Fiona Cairns shares her glamorous baking secrets.
